snippets.title: Table Preview

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {Table} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const {
        Container,
        Column,
        Footer,
        Header,
        Heading,
        Row,
        Section,
    } = Table;
</script>
snippets.title: Table Imports

snippets.script:
<script>
    import {Table} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Table.Container>
    <Table.Header>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading span_x={2}>
                span_x 2 x span_y 1
            </Table.Heading>

            <Table.Heading>
                span_x 1 x span_y 1
            </Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Header>

    <Table.Section>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                span_x 1 x span_y 1
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column span_y={2}>
                span_x 1 x span_y 2
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                span_x 1 x span_y 1
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Section>

    <Table.Footer>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading span_x={3}>
                span_x 3 x span_y 1
            </Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Footer>
</Table.Container>

data.text:
Table NOTE : Introduced feature in v0.2.7. Table is typically used to render tabular data in a structured row -> columns format, for end-users to easily read the contents. Minimum Maximum mobile 0px 640px tablet 641px 768px desktop 769px 1024px widescreen 1025px ∞ Minimum Maximum Table Imports Spans NOTE : Introduced feature in v0.4.4. WARNING : This feature was renamed from colspan / rowspan to span_x / span_y in v0.6.0 respectively. You can use the span_x / span_y properties on / to adjust the size of table items they take up. span_x 2 x span_y 1 span_x 1 x span_y 1 span_x 1 x span_y 1 span_x 1 x span_y 2 span_x 1 x span_y 1 span_x 3 x span_y 1 Borders You can make a Table have borders via the variation property. Minimum Maximum mobile 0px 640px tablet 641px 768px desktop 769px 1024px widescreen 1025px ∞ Minimum Maximum Stripes You can make a Table have stripes via the variation property. Minimum Maximum mobile 0px 640px tablet 641px 768px desktop 769px 1024px widescreen 1025px ∞ Minimum Maximum Borders + Stripes You can make a Table have both borders AND stripes via the variation property. Minimum Maximum mobile 0px 640px tablet 641px 768px desktop 769px 1024px widescreen 1025px ∞ Minimum Maximum Sizing NOTE : Introduced feature in v0.3.5. You can change the sizes / spacings of the child elements via the sizing property.

Table.Container.name: --table-palette-background-lightest
Table.Container.description: Controls the default RGB color value used for borders / stripes variations.

Table.Container.name: --table-sizing-text-size
Table.Container.description: Controls the default font size used for text, and the relative base for padding.

Table.Container.name: --table-sizing-line-height
Table.Container.description: Controls the default line height used.

Table.Container.name: --table-borders-border-radius
Table.Container.description: Controls the border-radius used for borders variation.

Table.Container.name: --table-borders-opacity
Table.Container.description: Controls the opacity used for borders variation.

Table.Container.name: --table-borders-width
Table.Container.description: Controls the width / height (depending on border orientation) used for borders variation.

Table.Container.name: --table-stripes-opacity
Table.Container.description: Controls the opacity used for stripes variation.

Table.Container.name: --table-column-padding-x
Table.Container.description: Controls the X-Axis padding used for table columns.

Table.Container.name: --table-column-padding-y
Table.Container.description: Controls the Y-Axis padding used for table columns.

Table.Container.name: sizing
Table.Container.description: Sets the size of children / spacing relative to the font size of the Table.Container.

Table.Container.name: variation
Table.Container.description: Alters how the Table.Container renders with various additions.

Table.Column.name: colspan
Table.Column.description: Adjusts the column table span of the Table.Column via colspan .

Table.Column.name: rowspan
Table.Column.description: Adjusts the column table span of the Table.Column via rowspan .

Table.Heading.name: colspan
Table.Heading.description: Adjusts the column table span of the Table.Heading via colspan .

Table.Heading.name: rowspan
Table.Heading.description: Adjusts the column table span of the Table.Heading via rowspan .

data.render:
NOTE: Introduced feature in v0.2.7.

Table is typically used to render tabular data in a structured row -> columns format, for end-users to easily read the contents.

<script>
    import {
        Code,
        Table,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Table.Container>
    <Table.Header>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading />
            <Table.Heading>Minimum</Table.Heading>
            <Table.Heading>Maximum</Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Header>

    <Table.Section>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">mobile</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>0px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>640px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">tablet</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>641px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>768px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">desktop</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>769px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>1024px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">widescreen</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>1025px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>∞</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Section>

    <Table.Footer>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading />
            <Table.Heading>Minimum</Table.Heading>
            <Table.Heading>Maximum</Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Footer>
</Table.Container>

Table Imports

<script>
    import {Table} from "@kahi-ui/framework";

    const {
        Container,
        Column,
        Footer,
        Header,
        Heading,
        Row,
        Section,
    } = Table;
</script>

Spans

NOTE: Introduced feature in v0.4.4.

WARNING: This feature was renamed from colspan / rowspan to span_x / span_y in v0.6.0 respectively.

You can use the span_x / span_y properties on <Table.Column> / <Table.Heading> to adjust the size of table items they take up.

<script>
    import {Table} from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Table.Container>
    <Table.Header>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading span_x={2}>
                span_x 2 x span_y 1
            </Table.Heading>

            <Table.Heading>
                span_x 1 x span_y 1
            </Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Header>

    <Table.Section>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                span_x 1 x span_y 1
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column span_y={2}>
                span_x 1 x span_y 2
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                span_x 1 x span_y 1
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Section>

    <Table.Footer>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading span_x={3}>
                span_x 3 x span_y 1
            </Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Footer>
</Table.Container>

Borders

You can make a Table have borders via the variation property.

<script>
    import {
        Code,
        Table,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Table.Container variation="borders">
    <Table.Header>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading />
            <Table.Heading>Minimum</Table.Heading>
            <Table.Heading>Maximum</Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Header>

    <Table.Section>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">mobile</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>0px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>640px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">tablet</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>641px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>768px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">desktop</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>769px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>1024px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">widescreen</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>1025px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>∞</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Section>

    <Table.Footer>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading />
            <Table.Heading>Minimum</Table.Heading>
            <Table.Heading>Maximum</Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Footer>
</Table.Container>

Stripes

You can make a Table have stripes via the variation property.

<script>
    import {
        Code,
        Table,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Table.Container variation="stripes">
    <Table.Header>

            <Table.Heading />

            <Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>768px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">desktop</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>769px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>1024px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">widescreen</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>1025px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>∞</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Section>

    <Table.Footer>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading />
            <Table.Heading>Minimum</Table.Heading>
            <Table.Heading>Maximum</Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Footer>
</Table.Container>

Borders + Stripes

You can make a Table have both borders AND stripes via the variation property.

<script>
    import {
        Code,
        Table,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Table.Container variation={["borders", "stripes"]}>
    <Table.Header>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading />
            <Table.Heading>Minimum</Table.Heading>
            <Table.Heading>Maximum</Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Header>

    <Table.Section>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">mobile</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>0px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>640px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">tablet</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>641px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>768px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">desktop</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>769px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>1024px</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>

        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Column>
                <Text is="strong">widescreen</Text>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>1025px</Code>
            </Table.Column>

            <Table.Column>
                <Code>∞</Code>
            </Table.Column>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Section>

    <Table.Footer>
        <Table.Row>
            <Table.Heading />
            <Table.Heading>Minimum</Table.Heading>
            <Table.Heading>Maximum</Table.Heading>
        </Table.Row>
    </Table.Footer>
</Table.Container>

Sizing

NOTE: Introduced feature in v0.3.5.

You can change the sizes / spacings of the child elements via the sizing property.

<script>
    import {
        Code,
        Stack,
        Table,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>

<Stack.Container spacing="medium">
    <div>
        <Text is="strong">DEFAULT</Text>

        <Table.Container variation="borders">
            <Table.Header>
                <Table.Row>
                    <Table.Heading />
                    <Table.Heading>
                        Minimum
                    </Table.Heading>

                    <Table.Heading>
                        Maximum

            </Table.Header>

You can make a Table scrollable by wrapping it with a Scrollable.

    import {
        Code,
        Scrollable,
        Table,
        Text,
    } from "@kahi-ui/framework";
</script>
